name: 1960 Valdivia Earthquake
description: Most powerful earthquake ever recorded

name: 2004 Indian Ocean Earthquake
location: Off the west coast of Sumatra, Indonesia
description: Generated massive tsunami affecting 14 countries

name: 1964 Alaska Earthquake
description: Most powerful earthquake recorded in North America

name: 2011 Tōhoku Earthquake
location: Off the Pacific coast of Japan
description: Triggered devastating tsunami and Fukushima nuclear disaster

name: 1952 Kamchatka Earthquake
description: Undersea earthquake with tsunami affecting Pacific coast

name: 2005 Nias-Simeulue Earthquake
location: Off the west coast of Sumatra, Indonesia
description: Part of the 2004-2005 Sumatra-Andaman earthquake sequence

name: 2012 Indian Ocean Earthquake
location: Off the west coast of Sumatra, Indonesia
description: Triggered tsunami warnings across Indian Ocean

name: 2007 Sumatra Earthquake
location: Off the west coast of Sumatra, Indonesia
description: Aftershock of the 2004 Indian Ocean earthquake

name: 1965 Rat Islands Earthquake
description: Undersea earthquake in the Aleutian Islands

name: 2013 Sea of Okhotsk Earthquake
description: Deep undersea earthquake with minor tsunami

name: 2009 Samoa Earthquake
description: Triggered tsunami affecting Samoa, American Samoa, and Tonga

name: 2010 Chile Earthquake
description: Affected central Chile, caused significant damage to infrastructure

name: 2003 Hokkaido Earthquake
description: Offshore earthquake with tsunami affecting Hokkaido coast

name: 1998 Papua New Guinea Earthquake
description: Triggered landslides that destroyed entire villages

name: 2015 Nepal Earthquake
description: Triggered avalanches on Mount Everest

name: 2010 Haiti Earthquake
description: Catastrophic damage in densely populated area

name: 2008 Sichuan Earthquake
description: Destroyed schools and infrastructure, massive death toll

name: 2005 Kashmir Earthquake
description: Affected Pakistan, India, and Afghanistan

name: 1999 İzmit Earthquake
description: Struck during morning rush hour, destroyed Istanbul suburbs

name: 1995 Kobe Earthquake
description: Struck densely populated urban area, caused fires and liquefaction

name: 1989 Loma Prieta Earthquake
description: Interrupted World Series broadcast, caused Bay Bridge damage

name: 1985 Mexico City Earthquake
description: Epicenter offshore, but amplified in soft lakebed soil of Mexico City

name: 1976 Tangshan Earthquake
description: Struck at 3:42 AM, destroyed entire city

name: 1971 San Fernando Earthquake
description: Caused collapse of freeway overpasses

name: 1906 San Francisco Earthquake
description: Destroyed over 80% of San Francisco

name: 1896 Sanriku Earthquake
description: Generated tsunami that devastated coastal villages

name: 1886 Charleston Earthquake
description: Most damaging earthquake in U.S. history at the time

name: 1811-1812 New Madrid Earthquakes
description: Series of three massive earthquakes in sparsely populated area

name: 1755 Lisbon Earthquake
description: Destroyed Lisbon, triggered tsunami across Atlantic

name: 1556 Shaanxi Earthquake
description: Deadliest earthquake in recorded history

name: 2018 Lombok Earthquake
description: Series of earthquakes affecting tourist island

name: 2016 Kaikōura Earthquake
description: Complex rupture along multiple faults

name: 2014 Iquique Earthquake
description: Long buildup before rupture, minimal casualties due to warnings

name: 2006 Pangandaran Earthquake
description: Struck popular tourist area, caused significant tsunami

name: 1994 Northridge Earthquake
description: Struck at 4:31 AM, caused $40 billion in damage

name: 1988 Spitak Earthquake
description: Struck during morning hours, destroyed Soviet-era apartment buildings

name: 1978 Tabas Earthquake
description: Struck remote desert area, destroyed mud-brick homes

name: 1939 Erzincan Earthquake
description: Struck at night, destroyed city of Erzincan

name: 1923 Great Kantō Earthquake
description: Followed by fires that destroyed Tokyo and Yokohama

name: 1915 Avezzano Earthquake
description: Destroyed medieval town, one of Italy's deadliest earthquakes

name: 1908 Messina Earthquake
description: Struck at 5:20 AM, destroyed Messina and Reggio Calabria
